subject: Technology
title: Cobots: Robots Working With Humans
description: A quick, practical guide to Cobots: Robots Working With Humans.

hook.text: Traditional factory robots are so dangerous they work behind cages. Cobots work right next to you.

buildup.text: Collaborative robots, or cobots, have force sensors that make them stop instantly if they touch a human.

discovery.text: Cobots handle boring or ergonomically harmful tasks while humans do the complex work. They're assistants, not replacements.

twist.text: Small businesses can now afford cobots costing $25,000, a fraction of traditional industrial robots costing hundreds of thousands.

climax.text: The cobot market is the fastest-growing segment in robotics. Teamwork between humans and machines is the future.

punchline.text: The best robot isn't one that replaces you. It's one that helps you.

quiz.question: What makes cobots different from traditional industrial robots?
options: They are faster and more powerful
They safely work alongside humans with force sensors
